scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. Previously, one of the team members, Alex, said, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time,' and you responded by encouraging the team to stay focused and work together. During a team meeting, [Monica] slammed her pen on the table and added, 'Even if we try our best, there's no way we can meet this deadline.' [Bob] nodded in agreement, looking equally concerned. You suggested taking a pause to rethink the approach. With the team gathered again, [Monica] leaned back in her chair, crossing her arms, and said, 'So, what’s the new grand plan?' You invited collaborative problem-solving by suggesting, 'Let's brainstorm some ideas together. We need everyone's input to come up with a viable plan.' [Monica] rolled her eyes and said, 'Brainstorming isn’t going to magically give us more hours in the day.' [Bob] added, 'I mean, if we’re going to do this, we need concrete steps, not just ideas.' You then focused on motivating the team to tackle the task head-on.
scenes.description: [Monica] sighs deeply and says, 'Motivation is great, but we still need a plan. What exactly are we doing first?' [Bob] looks at you, waiting for a clear direction.

options.text: Let's break down the project into manageable chunks and assign each part to a small group.
options.analysis: You suggested a practical approach to divide the work, showing good emotional perception and empathy.

options.text: I get it. Let's focus on the most urgent tasks first and see if we can redistribute some of the workload.
options.analysis: You acknowledged the team's need for a clear plan and proposed a step-by-step approach, showing good self-regulation and motivation.

options.text: We've managed tight deadlines before. Let's stay positive and tackle this with determination.
options.analysis: You focused on keeping the team motivated and determined, demonstrating high motivation but lower empathy and emotional perception.
